intro: Peckia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam peckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring humid and tropical climates. It is often found in regions of Brazil, Guyana, and Suriname. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
